page.title: 08WHY HONDA CHOSE SWINDON
page.content:
{Honda's}decision to establish a site at South Marston has been front page news in the Swindon local newspapers and has been a major topic of conversation. Some have called the decision as important as that taken by the Great Western Railway in 1840 to establish their workshops at Swindon.
{Why was Swindon chosen? {1.}The car with which Honda will be most concerned is the Project XX being developed in collaboration with British car company Austin Rover. Austin Rover already have a car body plant at Swindon and the new car will be assembled at Cowley only 40 kilometres from Swindon. {2.}The South Marston site includes the former Vickers airfield which offers both a runway for executive aircraft and an excellent car testing track.
